Methods

BSplineToBezier(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>, int)

Converts a B-spline with polynomial order degree to a series of Bezier control points via Boehm's algorithm.

public static Vector2[] BSplineToBezier(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2> controlPoints, int degree)

Parameters

controlPoints ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>

The control points.

degree int

The polynomial order.

Returns

Vector2[]

An array of vectors containing control point positions for the resulting Bezier curve.

Remarks

Does nothing if controlPoints has zero points or one point. Algorithm unsuitable for large values of degree with many knots.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

degree was less than 1.

BSplineToPiecewiseLinear(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>, int)

Creates a piecewise-linear approximation of a clamped uniform B-spline with polynomial order degree, by dividing it into a series of bezier control points at its knots, then adaptively repeatedly subdividing those until their approximation error vanishes below a given threshold.

public static List<Vector2> BSplineToPiecewiseLinear(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2> controlPoints, int degree)

Parameters

controlPoints ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>

The control points.

degree int

The polynomial order.

Returns

List<Vector2>

A list of vectors representing the piecewise-linear approximation.

Remarks

Does nothing if controlPoints has zero points or one point. Generalises to bezier approximation functionality when degree is too large to create knots. Algorithm unsuitable for large values of degree with many knots.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

degree was less than 1.

BezierToPiecewiseLinear(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>)

Creates a piecewise-linear approximation of a bezier curve, by adaptively repeatedly subdividing the control points until their approximation error vanishes below a given threshold.

public static List<Vector2> BezierToPiecewiseLinear(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2> controlPoints)

Parameters

controlPoints ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>

The control points.

Returns

List<Vector2>

A list of vectors representing the piecewise-linear approximation.

LinearToPiecewiseLinear(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>)

Creates a piecewise-linear approximation of a linear curve. Basically, returns the input.

Parameters

Returns

List<Vector2>

A list of vectors representing the piecewise-linear approximation.

PiecewiseLinearToBSpline(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>, int, int, int, int, float, float, float, List<Vector2>?, float[,]?)

Creates a B-spline approximation from a piecewise-linear path.

public static List<Vector2> PiecewiseLinearToBSpline(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2> inputPath, int numControlPoints, int degree, int numTestPoints = 100, int maxIterations = 100, float learningRate = 8, float b1 = 0.8, float b2 = 0.99, List<Vector2>? initialControlPoints = null, float[,]? learnableMask = null)

Parameters

inputPath ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>

The piecewise-linear path to approximate.

numControlPoints int

The number of control points to use in the B-spline approximation.

degree int

The polynomial order.

numTestPoints int

The number of points to evaluate the B-spline path at for optimization, basically a resolution.

maxIterations int

The number of optimization steps.

learningRate float

The rate of optimization. Larger values converge faster but can be unstable.

b1 float

The B1 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.

b2 float

The B2 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.

initialControlPoints List<Vector2>

The initial B-spline control points to use before optimization. The length of this list should be equal to numControlPoints.

learnableMask float[,]

Mask determining which control point positions are fixed and cannot be changed by the optimiser.

Returns

List<Vector2>

A List of vectors representing the B-spline control points.

PiecewiseLinearToBezier(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>, int, int, int, float, float, float, List<Vector2>?, float[,]?)

Creates a bezier curve approximation from a piecewise-linear path.

public static List<Vector2> PiecewiseLinearToBezier(ReadOnlySpan<Vector2> inputPath, int numControlPoints, int numTestPoints = 100, int maxIterations = 100, float learningRate = 8, float b1 = 0.8, float b2 = 0.99, List<Vector2>? initialControlPoints = null, float[,]? learnableMask = null)

Parameters

inputPath ReadOnlySpan<Vector2>

The piecewise-linear path to approximate.

numControlPoints int

The number of control points to use in the bezier approximation.

numTestPoints int

The number of points to evaluate the bezier path at for optimization, basically a resolution.

maxIterations int

The number of optimization steps.

learningRate float

The rate of optimization. Larger values converge faster but can be unstable.

b1 float

The B1 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.

b2 float

The B2 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.

initialControlPoints List<Vector2>

The initial bezier control points to use before optimization. The length of this list should be equal to numControlPoints.

learnableMask float[,]

Mask determining which control point positions are fixed and cannot be changed by the optimiser.

Returns

List<Vector2>

A List of vectors representing the bezier control points.
